Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Rita8740
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe Queen Queen room on the 12th floor. We had a great view of the city, could also see mountains, beds were extremely comfortable, nice sitting area in room, excellent service, very friendly staff, great location. Easy walking distance to Pike Place Market, Seattle Art Museum, REI for new hiking boots. We got a kick out of the seagull that came to our window - fed him bits of apple! Last year we stayed at the Inn at Market. Was twice the price (great view but smaller room) and I preferred the Mayflower! Will definitely stay at the Mayflower next trip to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service and very rude management”
Reviews.Author: travels52
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, the hallway and room smelled of smoke. Perhaps I should have complained then as I received a call from manager of the hotel a couple hours later accusing me of smoking in the room. I explained the situation to him and thought it was settled. Unfortunately when I checked out several days later, the hotel added a smoking charge to the bill. I asked to speak to the manager who was very rude and said he would not remove the charge. I asked him to go up to the room with me to see himself if the inside of my room was smoke filled. He refused and started yelling at me. I have never been treated so rudely by management and I travel on business at minimum 4 days out of every week. I would recommend that no one stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The bar at Oliver's is one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela W
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an amazing package deal at the Mayflower Park Hotel. The breakfast was simply delicious and the service was excellent in the Andalucca Restaurant. What a welcoming, well-run hotel. We will be sure to return. Happy hour at Oliver's was a highlight!

Reviews.Title: “Mayflower Park Hotel great”
Reviews.Author: grp_10
Reviews.Content: Best location in Seattle. Can walk to great restaurants, the market and theaters. Comfortable, classy-but not stuffy. Friendly staff. Bring candy for the automobile valet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place Overall”
Reviews.Author: Momofmcl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one weekend Feb 24-26,2012 for a 2 night,3 day stay. I was impressed most with the location, very close to lots of shopping, restaurants and even reasonable walking distance to the piers. The rooms were clean,nicely decorated with an old world charm. The only reason I did not give them 5 stars was because parking was $35/ a night plus tip, which was not told to us in advanced. In my opinion this is outrageous and with really no other parking options available in the downtown Seattle area near the hotel you are pretty much stuck paying it, just wish parking price was clearly advertised beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Anna G
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to the Mayflower Park Hotel and again found it to be excellent. The hotel has an old world Northwest elegance...not overdone, warm and inviting. It is wonderfully located in downtown within walking distance of Pike Place Market, the Seattle Art Museum, as well as Seattle's numerous and very enjoyable shopping experiences. I stay there for business or pleasure as many of the companies I work with are also located nearby in downtown. As a single female travelling alone, one of the things I most appreciate about this hotel is the excellent and reliable staff. From the Valet to the Bellman, Front Desk and Concierge, everyone is friendly, respectful and willing to assist in any reasonable way. I recognize many of the employees from over the years, which, to me, means that there must be some employee satisfaction. Perhaps that is what puts the service over the top. I also really enjoy the atmosphere of Oliver's Restaurant at the hotel. The menu is a perfect size making for a quick and easy decision. I have tried most things on the menu and tend to like them all. My top recommendations are the crab cakes or the hamburger. Whatever you choose, get the fries as your side dish. I would travel a long way just for those. If you enjoy a cocktail, sit at the bar and watch the weather wash over the dramatically lit street sign indicating 4th and Pine Street. It is very mesmerizing at night. When I'm in Seattle my schedule is almost always overfull and I find the Mayflower Park Hotel to be a very lovely respite in the middle of it all. Many thanks to all of the wonderful employees and to the owners for keeping this charming historic property in place and thriving.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelHound365
Reviews.Content: Central location within walking distance to most venues as well as the Seattle Light Rail which was convenient to and from Sea-Tac. Room was well appointed and inviting with excellent city views. Staff was professional and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Kassandra B
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully charming historic hotel located in downtown Seattle. I'll never stay anywhere else! This boutique hotel came highly recommended by a colleague in California who has stayed here numerous times. The Mayflower absolutely exceeded my expectations. I am so glad that the hotel I had planned to stay at for a big conference at the Washington State Convention Center was booked. The Mayflower Park Hotel was less expensive and far superior (we stayed four nights). The ambience in the lobby and upper sitting room by the fireplace is comfortably elegant and inviting. All the staff, from the moment we entered, were extremely professional, kind, and knowledgeable. The concierges are very helpful. Jane did our booking for the Seattle 2-Hour Van Tour (great tour, by the way) and Andy secured for us a fantastic museum package for the Gauguin Exhibit at the Seattle Art Museum. They made my birthday very, very special, even delivering a small box of chocolates to our room with a birthday card signed by numerous staff. Katya at the front desk is lovely and the doormen are courteous and have friendly smiles. Our deluxe room on the 9th floor had 2 bathrooms and a view of the Space Needle with free wifi. Oliver's on the main floor is perfect for happy hour drinks and hors d'oeuvres in the late afternoon. The West Center Shopping Mall is connected to the hotel as is the Monorail station to the Space Needle and the Link Light Railway Tunnel Station to the Sea-Tac Airport, 35 minutes away. All the Seattle highlights are within walking distance -- even the Space Needle, to which we walked for dinner at the Needle's Sky Restaurant (about a 20 minute walk). The Mayflower Park Hotel made our first visit to Seattle a dream. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: tripper123
Reviews.Content: This was my first sightseeing trip to Seattle and the Mayflower Park was the perfect place for me. Itâ€™s a historic place within easy walking distance to anything and everything I wanted to do in 3.5 days. The light rail from the airport is so easy to use and the 3rd Avenue exit is just around the corner and down the block from the hotel. I was able to check-in early, always a plus. My room was fine but I was directly across from the ice machine and I could hear it repeatedly during the evening. I also faced the Westlake Center and on that side there is a lot of very noisy equipment that runs all the time. Iâ€™m used to dead quiet at night so I thought this was going to be a real problem but I slept reasonably well every night. Must have been all that walking, fresh air and using the hotelâ€™s small but adequate fitness center. I recommend Oliverâ€™s, great service the night I was there even though it was busy, and room service, also good service, and an excellent, hot, burger. Andalucaâ€™s though was not my best dining experience. The food was tasty but barely warm for both the breakfast and dinner I had there. No idea why that would have happened â€“ twice. The coffee was hot though and very good. Another big plus was that the Chocolate Indulgence tour through Savor Seattle starts right at the hotelâ€™s upper lobby. I didnâ€™t know that when I booked the hotel but it worked out very well and Iâ€™d recommend the tour. All in all, Iâ€™d go back to the Mayflower Park in a second. I like a good walking city (the front desk folks are really good with directions) and from here it was easy to get to Pikeâ€™s Place Market, the aquarium, Minerâ€™s Landing, the Seattle Art Museum and the Regal Theatres (also thereâ€™s an AMC about the same distance). Plenty of excellent food and drink a stoneâ€™s throw from all of these places. If you choose the Mayflower Park I think youâ€™ll enjoy it. I certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Piece of Old Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Ziprodot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel during a recent vacation and were very pleased! The hotel is centrally located near all of the major Seattle attractions that everyone wants to see: Pike Place Market, the Seattle Aquarium, etc. It wasn't just the central location that was wonderful about the hotel, but also the attention of the staff. On our way into town, my wife called the hotel to ask about a local place that she could go to to get a pedicure. They not only provided the name of the shop, but made the reservation for her. We also asked about a great restaurant to try and they were not only happy to provide a name, Cutters (check out my review about them!), but also had the restaurant send over their free shuttle. Our room at the hotel was like stepping back in time. The room was spacious and very comfortable, with beautiful furniture and fixtures. The bathroom was also wonderful. Everything was also very clean. In the end, the staff, facilities, and location all added up to a hotel that we will definitely visit again during our next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Step Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: pfbird
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights on business and found the hotel to be friendly, charming and very old world. Granted, it seemed a bit threadbare in places. But the staff was more than accommodating, and the location was perfect to access the Pike Place market, Nordstrom's and many top-flight restaurants. Specifically, my room was a cozy queen, just right for a person traveling alone. It was decorated in classic traditional furniture and fabrics. The bathroom was tight, with a modern shower head, but an old-fashoned tub and pedestal sink. The toiletries were good, but the bathroom -- while spotless -- could have used some updating. The classic TV cabinet contained a modern Vizio TV. The fitness area was outstanding, though small, equipped with two modern treadmills, a stair-stepper and an exercise bike. Internet service was free and powerful -- always a plus. Another plus was the restaurant and a separate cafe-bar under the same roof -- one on each side of the lobby. The food was excellent, ranging from BLT sandwiches to pepper scallops. Moreover, the wine was reasonably priced by the glass. I would agree with the reviews that grumble about the thin walls. I could hear someone's cell phone ringing and faint voices next door to my room. But fortunately, it wasn't loud enough to disturb -- just to distract. All in all, I considered it a good value for the heart of the city, and substantially less expensive than the towering Westin just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. Our room was small but adequate. My biggest disappointment came after we checked out. The following morning, I realized I had left my coat in the closet in the room. My husband contacted the hotel the by phone and e-mail. Received a reply the following day -nothing was found. I have now talked to the hotel three times. They continue to say housekeeping found nothing. Since I am more than 100% sure that's where it was - I will assume someone took it for themselves. Very disappointed that staff cannot be trusted to turn in left behind items. Someone got a very nice Columbia coat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LocalGirl55
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed here, and we will definitely be back. The service is cheerful and prompt. The public areas and rooms are clean and in good repair. It is an old building, but it has been lovingly restored, and the care is obvious. We had a single queen room, which was spacious with a sitting area and views of the city. You could see the Olympic Mountains with the Sound, and part of Lake Union, both views through the buildings, but we were only on the 9th floor. The room was quiet, the bed comfortable. They've put a shelf in the bathroom so there is a place to put your toiletries. We at at the restaurant, Andaluca, for the first time, it was cozy and very good. It was an easy 10-minute walk to the Paramount Theater, and shopping is even closer. We love the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and good value”
Reviews.Author: michael r
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the package that included the Paul Gauguin exhibit at the Seattle Art Museum. We have stayed in this general area of Seattle before, but never before at this hotel. First impression was very friendly and helpful staff from the moment we pulled up to the entrance. We spoke to staff throughout our stay and found them always to be cheery and helpful. The hotel has an old elegance which we enjoyed. The room more than met our needs, was very clean and bright, very quiet, and supplied all we wanted. We find this location to be the best in terms of what we like to do in Seattle (ie. restaurants, shopping, concert hall, art museum, Pike Place Market, waterfront, and easy access to other downtown locations. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than fine, but not special”
Reviews.Author: z_portland
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The rooms & beds were good. We enjoyed the two bath rooms, but the room and decor are a little tired. General view was just okay, but sitting on one of the beds, we had a beautiful sliver view of the Space Needle. The rate for our package was absolutely fantastic, which included tickets to the Gauguin exhibit. The staff was fine, but didn't seem especially happy to help us. I would only choose this hotel again over one of the many great ones in Seattle if the rate was right.

Reviews.Title: “best value”
Reviews.Author: aziza43
Reviews.Content: If you ever are in Seattle,you should stay at the Mayflower hotel.It combines old elegance with modern facilities.It is very conveniently situated,near the sky train and only a 10 min.walk to the famous Market square.The rooms are very spacious and especially check the Olive's bar where you can grab a snack while the barman mixes your favorite drink.Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Paula H
Reviews.Content: Our favorite in downtown Seattle. We stayed overnight the Friday before President's Day. Great package with tickets to the Seattle Art Museum's Gaugin exhibit and valet parking. Location is the best. We could walk to SAM, Pike Place Market, the 5th Avenue Theater to see Oklahoma. Oliver's is a beautiful historic bar. Never had the same type of room twice, but have always felt pampered. Staff is friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mayflower Park Hotel Seattle”
Reviews.Author: wisetraveller52
Reviews.Content: Absolutely charming hotel with the best staff ever. Location is perfect, close to Pike Street Market, shops and lots of good dining. We had the deluxe room with two queens and two baths, very comfy beds and quiet. Hotel bar is very quaint and nice. Overall this place is great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Elegance”
Reviews.Author: DTGCARM
Reviews.Content: Clean, elegant, classic and comfortable are the words that come to mind when I think about my stay at Mayflower Park Hotel. The staff were exceptional! I was greeted first by a most gracious valet, and then by 'John', one of the front desk guest service agents; very professional and attentive. I would certainly stay there again and recommend Mayflower Park Hotel to anyone looking for accomodation in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place...”
Reviews.Author: Alexis331
Reviews.Content: Found the Mayflower Park Hotel on tripadvisor of course. Love the traditional decor and the location is great...Macy's is across the street and Nordstrom's is a block away. Not only was the room comfortable (if available request a corner room...a little more spacious and nice city views). And, a wonderful surprise is the hotel bar, Oliver's. Happy hour every day at 4:30 with great martini's & food and interesting locals to chat with while people-watching out of the corner windows behind the bar. Great restaurants, Pike's Market and Seattle Art Museum are walking distance. If you don't want to walk in the rain, this is a hub for all the major transportation available. Definitely a nice small hotel with good service at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Tinkvasi
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Mayflower for five days. It is wonderfully situated for somebody coming from the airport. The Sound Transit comes extremely close to their front door. It could hardly get any easier and efficient. The doorman are not only courteous but informative and friendly. The lobby is beautiful without being pretentious. We were aware that their rooms might be considered small so we requested the mini suite. The mini suite is economically priced and is very comfortable. It not only had a comfortable sized bathroom but also a separate vanity and wet bar area, a decent sized closet, a desk area, a comfortable sized living area with a nice sized television and a seperate bedroom with pocket doors. The bathroom is stocked with permanent full sized toiletries. The bed was wonderful to sleep in-not too hard and not too soft. There is also another television in the bedroom as well. At check in we were provided a coupon to their restaurant- use it! Our view of the city was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation!”
Reviews.Author: cldrmd
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Mayflower and we will be making it a midwinter break tradition from now on. From the $5.00 parking special, to the 5% rate special, and a new guest, room upgrade, it just kept getting better. The location is terrific for sightseeing and shopping. We didn't need a car in spite of the rainy weather. The front desk accommodated us for both early check in and late check out. Our room service was good and very prompt. Overall the service was excellent. This small quiet gem is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: drptravel
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Mayflower Park. Each time it is great, but even better this time. From check in to check out the staff were excellent. All the staff were attentive and were always asking what they could assist us with. Oliver's is a great lounge and the Royale cocktail was delicious. This is a beautiful lounge, a relaxing place to sip and talk. Andaluca is the restaurant at the hotel. Excellent breakfast. The crab omelette was tasty and seasoned expertly. I would recommend the Mayflower for a greatstay in the heart of Seattle. Valet parking is a bonus in this location!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait”
Reviews.Author: ffpp
Reviews.Content: I have booked mayflower hotel for july 7th and just can't wait to go after reading all the great reviews. Called the hotel directly to book and that was a very positive experience. We go to seattle each year for a cruise and am so happy to have found this hotel instead of the usual cookie cutters we have been staying in. Will let you know how it was upon our return home.

Reviews.Title: “Business made easy”
Reviews.Author: Marissa G
Reviews.Content: My recent two night trip to the Mayflower was great! Upon checking in, I found that I'd been upgraded and had a nice large confortable room with a king size bed. The staff was fantastic, (front desk, out front, conceirge and restaurant) helpful, pleasant, professional and went the extra mile. Whether it was walking me to a specific door and giving me directions, arranging for cabs or ensuring I had the copies I needed for a business trip, they really provided great service. I'd definitely stay here again... reasonable rate, great location and overall a really nice hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: northsantiam
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, room was fantastic, really big for a basic room. Great bathtub, nice amenities Location was great for downtown cruising and also easy walking to Pikes Place Market. We received free Valet parking with the "mystery hotel" on "bookit.com". Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , Great location”
Reviews.Author: Marc G
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Mayflower Park . Staff is very friendly and helpful, the location is excellent . Will stay again !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Litzza
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel, the room was perfect and the location couldn't be better, it is close to everything: the Pike market, Macy's is accross the street, malls, good restaurants etc. The room was at the top with a little bit of a view and we also got a promotion of $5 parking since we booked it directly with the hotel.The staff is super friendly and the restaurant and bar at great.

Reviews.Title: “Style, Elegance, and Pride”
Reviews.Author: ABOV
Reviews.Content: I am reviewing the Mayflower Park Hotel because my husband and I have had 3 company dinner parties here and have been very pleased with the service. We have used the Green Room (for our first small party of 12), the Plymouth Room (for one of our largest dinner parties) and the Fireside Room (for our cozy Christmas Party). Our guests consistently come back for the parties and favorably commented on the beautiful and ornate decorations, the no-hassle valet parking (which is free!) and the incredible food prepared by Chef Wayne Johnson. This is a wonderful place to host your parties! It is worth the investment and the planning staff works hard to meet all your company needs. The hotel sleeping rooms are also nice. We usually have random drawings at our dinner parties and one of the gifts is a night's stay at the hotel and the winners have consistently expressed their thanks and satisfaction at having been able to stay in the Queen Anne- style rooms. I do look forward to hosting another dinner party here soon. One of the things that the catering manager always assures you is that the decorations and atmosphere will be beautiful and he has been right everytime. It is perhaps one of the most elegant places in Seattle. You will have a wait staff to take care of all your needs during the party- but make sure to request that the staff members be veterans and not new ones (that is, new on the job) because you want the attentiveness to detail that only the seasoned waiters consistently provide. Also they offer a coat check service - but it is best to have one of your employees/assistants to take care of this. Otherwise, everything else is just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: krissv
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a big to queen beds room, large enough but with a small bathroom. On the top floors you can get a little view of the city. The hotel is nice enough, a bit outdated and not to many extra fascilities. But the location is superb, in the heart of Seattle, close to everything, especially shopping. Can be a bit noisy

Reviews.Title: “So verrrry nice!”
Reviews.Author: Neverenoughtravel60
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this hotel, from the staff to the room to the hotel breakfast, all our expectations were met or exceeded. Wonderful friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: picky154944
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I bought a promotional package for 2 nights at this hotel that included breakfast and valet service. Our goal was to do a bit of shopping, rest, and go out for drinks and dinner. The location enabled us to do just that. Breakfast was great, as was the valet service. The hotel was quiet and elegant. Our room was fine but needed a bit of updating. The only disappointment was at Oliver's. We decided to go for a drink at Oliver's since it is so famous for martinis. Both the martini and the gin and tonic we ordered were very small and neither of us tasted any gin at all. My daughter had visited the lounge before and she said they loved the drinks here then. It was a relaxing and fun trip and we would return if a promotional package came along.

Reviews.Title: “nice weekend....!”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Put us on the list to be notified of special promotions. We're flexible. If we know when your occupancy is low and you're offering discounts to fill empty rooms, we're happy to "help".....

Reviews.Title: “If I were Eloise, I would stay here.”
Reviews.Author: DebraEllen
Reviews.Content: Remember Eloise, the little girl in the children's books who lived in the Plaza Hotel in New York? Well, I wish that was me, and I wish the hotel were the Mayflower Park. I was in Seattle for a ginormous conference in the Conference Center; I was avoiding sprawling conference sites like the plague. I wanted peace. Elegance. Beauty. Quiet. All that I got at the Mayflower. Andrew S.in reservations handled my complicated reservation without blinking. The staff were super friendly and accommodating. The hotel is quaint, elegant, not too big (12 floors), next to Nordstrom flagship store, short walk to Pike Place, about 10 minutes from the convention center... what's not to love? Plus that, I am pretty neurotic when it comes to sound, but the hotel was really very quiet, with minimal street noise. Oh, and Andalucca--a first rate Mediterranean restaurant is on the first floor. After the conference, my oldest friend (from grade three) drove down from Vancouver to spend a day visiting with me, and she found the hotel every bit as perfect. Thank you, Mayflower, for a truly wonderful stay. It was heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ratherbediving2
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of downtown, the buses, trolley, monorail and light rail are all accessible, and they have valet parking for those who need their own transportation. It is an older hotel that has been lovingly kept up, retaining its beauty, charm and identity, yet has incorporated the modern conveniences where you would wish them. Staff are knowledgeable and pleasant, The beds are comfortable. Although near everything, it is quiet. If you prefer to avoid the sterile 'bed in a box' of many hotels and crave a sense of history and identity, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home away from home for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Edward W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mayflower Park 4 times for business purposes. The location is very good for business or pleasure, being right between Macy's and the flagship Nordstrom store. It is 4 blocks from Purple Cafe (wine bar), a block from Lola (the donuts!), and very close to many other great downtown spots. Valet parking ONLY. Oliver's (the in-hotel bar) might look stuffy, but the staff are friendly and the drinks are top class. Food is generally tasty. Be sure to try several of the specialty martinis, including the Paradigm Shift (vodka, raspberry, champagne, campari). The "well" gin is Bombay Sapphire. If you need a cup of joe and are tired of the Starbucks routine (a huge location is a block away - a big glass walled building on a bustling corner), you can head 2 blocks down to Caffe Senso Unico, a coffee shop run by an Italian family. BEST value in downtown Seattle with FREE wifi. The ONE negative I can cite is that the building is on a busy corner, so if you are a light sleeper you might want to ask for an inside room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Room, Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: EpicureSlug
Reviews.Content: Centrally located downtown within walking distance of the Seattle Art Museum, convention center, theaters and great restaurants. It's a nicely refurbished old hotel with attractive furnishings. The bed and pillows were really comfy. The room was very quiet and, on the 10th floor, had a great view of the city. There was a nice flatscreen if you plan to watch television in Seattle. The staff was always upbeat, cheery, skilled and incredibly helpful. I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been a better trip!”
Reviews.Author: Denise C
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky to attend a wedding on New Year's Eve at the Mayflower. Everything was wonderful from the moment we stepped out of the car in valet. They recognized the bride and everyone from valets to the front desk to waiters made sure to congratulate her. The front desk was very helpful with our early check-in requests too. I wish that I could remember names of the fabulous people who helped us! Kim at Oliver's was amazing and Andrew from events was great. The only issue that we had in our 4 day stay was a snippy comment from a 20-something staff member (he could have been a waiter?) that we stopped in the lobby. He told us that "it wasn't his department" when we asked for help with the temperature of the banquet room. The front desk jumped to the rescue and fixed the problem quickly. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Place!”
Reviews.Author: Terrapindreamr
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, my boyfriend and I realized that staying downtown on New Years Eve after dining and hearing music was a way good idea. We recalled staying at the Mayflower about 6 months earlier, when we were drawn to its old world charm and vintage surroundings. We got lucky and scored a Queen sized room on the 11th floor, standard, but well-appointed, with space used wisely, affording us a great view of both a lively neighborhood and the skyline. Last time we were there, my bf got an amazing upgrade to suite, and it was the cats meow; huge, tons of windows. Bed is comfy, bathroom is great. Location is several blocks away from Pike Place Market if you are touring, but as a local, I love this place for its romantic atmosphere as well. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Downtown Seattle, bar none!”
Reviews.Author: melody p
Reviews.Content: This was the third year I have spent my new year's eve birthday at the Mayflower. What can I say, it just feels like home. From the moment I arrive at valet park I feel like the hotel is my home. The service and attention to detail is impecable. The rooms are old world spacious, clean, and up to date classic all rolled into one. Oliver's is the place to ring in the new year with classic cocktails remeniscent of a black and white movie with service to match. Yes, I've been to France, Australia, Mexico, Thailand...gimme the Mayflower for opulence and old world classic style any day!!! After a weekend there I feel like I've left the real world behind and traveled to grown up Disney Land!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: lyndairene
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower Park is great! I can not think of one negative thing about it. The front desk people were the best! I have stayed there 3 times now and is the only place I will stay in seattle from now on. The location is great....right across the street from Maceys and 3 blocks to pikes market. The food was great, nice bar, and the decor suburb! This is an old old hotel beautifully decorated.Can't wait to return!! Overall......excellant!

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: Ry B
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I are from the area, but we wanted to do something special for NYE, and after a little searching around, I came across the Mayflower Park's New Year's special. It was a good deal for a one night stay, and late check out on New Years Day was WONDERFUL. The room was definitely on the small side, if we had been staying more than one night it might've been a problem, but for one night it was fine. The valet staff were super friendly. The only real complaint I had was the price of the room service. I've stayed in PLENTY of hotels with pricey room service, but $5 for one glass of orange juice at breakfast? Seriously? I love Andaluca's food, but that's just absurd. I didn't want to spoil a romantic breakfast in bed starting off the new year, so I paid it anyway, but come on. I was also a little disheartened to learn that although the website advertises views of the space needle, a condo building has gone up in recent years that blocks the view from all but two rooms, which put a dent in some of our romantic weekend plans - we wanted to watch the fireworks from seattle center at midnight! I specifically requested a room with a view when I made our reservation but didn't learn about this until check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Made our anniversary extra special”
Reviews.Author: genme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayflower for our 25th wedding anniversary. We originally booked because of all the reviews and the hotels location. We will return because of the staff. The front desk greeted us with a Happy Anniversary! and they upgraded our room to a beautiful corner room king suite. After letting us check in early we dropped our bags and went out to shop. Everything was very close by. Upon returning to the room we found a box of chukar cherries (delicious) and a card that all of the staff had signed. We were very touched by the gesture. It is an older hotel but everything needed to be comfortable is updated. I love the books and info in the room giving the history of the hotel as well they are very proud of it and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what the fuss is about!”
Reviews.Author: DeeSmth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it got very high reviews. I prefer to pay a bit more for good service and value. The valet parking staff were very friendly and the room cleaners as well. Nothing special about the desk staff. The room we stayed in was tiny and a cramped bathroom. Reasonbly clean. The beds were extremely uncomfortable and the walls are paper thin. You can hear everything, all words of every conversation and also you can hear others in the washroom, no details needed. When I asked for earplugs, they offered to change rooms, which I wasn't keen on doing at midnight. But he said all rooms are like this in terms of thin walls and same beds. So what is the point of moving? We stayed in the same room. Very cramped space for 2 people. Ok if alone. Parking is 29$ not 20$ as listed in the Expedia website. It was ok, but there are so many better places to stay for same or cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to the Mayflower park every year (for the past 4 years) to celebrate his birthday. The staff has always treated us well and exceeded our expectations. Rooms are beautiful, clean and the location can't be beat. We have lived in Seattle all of our lives and each time we eat at Andaluca we say, "Why don't we come here more often?" The food is excellent! And you can't beat the cocktails at Olivers. Thanks again for a perfect weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful and the staff was beyond great.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday tradition”
Reviews.Author: rosie4751
Reviews.Content: Oliver's was fabulous for holiday cocktails with the family, beautiful hotel, excellent service, perfect location for shopping, seeing the sights, and walking distance from great restaurants. Fabulous breakfast at Adaluca's the next morning, overall, a perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “HELMS HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: Tawni H
Reviews.Content: We stayed on December 15 and enjoyed all the sights and sounds of the Christmas season. The hotel is superbly located for shopping, dining and entertainment with theatres all around. Everything is within walking distance. The staff were warm and welcoming. Upon check in they handed us a cute gift bag filled with chocolate and a delightful Christmas ornament. Valet parking will cost you $30 for 24 hours....they do mean 24 hours. Check out was at 11:00 but we were able to leave our car parked until 6:00 pm. They also had an extraordinary hot cocoa and cookie display for the guests.....loved it. Our visit was festive and beautiful....the Mayflower really rung in the holiday spirit for me in a sweet and nostalgic way!

Reviews.Title: “Great tradition!”
Reviews.Author: Susan W
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Mayflower Park Hotel annually for the last 20 years! This is part of the tradition in celebrating our wedding anniversary. We have always had fabulous service and the location is perfect for finishing up Christmas shopping!! We love it here!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Mayflower Park Hotel every December when I go into downtown Seattle for a concert. It is an old, wonderful hotel in great condition. It is located right in the heart of the shopping area and you can go into Westlake Center for shopping and restaurants without going out side. From Westlake Center you can access Nordstroms, Pacific Place and Macy's all without going outside. The bar is the greatest atmosphere and the restaurant is also. Great service, friendly staff. Everything you can possibly want and more.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Karlh46
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Mayflower when in Seattle over the past several years. The quality of the experience has always been excellent. This hotel has it all. Good location in the heart of downtown, spotless rooms and facilities, but most importantly a courteous, gracious and professional staff -- many of whom have been here for years. That says something to me about how staff is treated by the management. That care is most assuredly passed on to the guests. In addition the hotel has one of the nicest bars (Oliver's) in town with friendly servers and superb bartenders who make a martini for the ages. The restaurant Andaluca is a lovely, romantic room featuring a wonderful Mediterranean menu. Do not overlook their breakfast -- also excellent. The Mayflower offers a singular, civilized experience and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Old world comfort and service - felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: Margie202
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at Mayflower with my partner in September and after 37 hour travel time with only a few hours of sleep from Hobart, Australia, the greeting and service provided by the all the staff was a fantastic welcome to Seattle. Caught the fast train service from the airport to right near the hotel. Our room was comfortable, clean and quite spacious. The only drawback was not having a refrigerator in the room which is something we are used to. Most of the attractions like Pike market etc are in walking distance and being right in central Seattle shopping is a breeze. Olivers is a bar with class and character, the food was tasty and original and the complimentary evening snacks went well with drinks after walking for many hours. Seattle is a lovely city and coming from Hobart the weather was just like home to us!! I cannot fault any of the hotel staff from the doormen, barpersons, reception and restaurant staff who assisted us willingly and with great courtesy. They even managed to fix up our Boeing factory tour which I had booked online in Australia thinking public transport would be an option to get there. I would highly recommend staying at the Mayflower.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn_F_Anderson
Reviews.Content: The staff is fantastic! Everyone is friendly, helpful and courteous. The bar has excellent bartenders and attentive wait staff. The restaurant Andaluca is top notch - always good wine recommendations and THE BEST Paella (which can also be ordered in the bar). I've had Paella in Spain, Andaluca's is better! The wait staff in the restaurant is also knowledgeable, friendly, dedicated to customer service. Location is great - easy to get to any part of Seattle, across the street from Macy's and a quick walk to Pike Place, even in the winter. I have been staying at Mayflower Park every other week for the past 4 months and from the first day everything was terrific. There a loads of restaurants within walking distance if you want to venture out. My favorite rooms are the Deluxe rooms, which are a bit more spacious, but, the regular rooms are good too. The beds have really nice pillows of varying densities. The rooms are always clean and the housekeeping staff is very nice. I would recommend this hotel above any others, which I have stayed in several. The Mayflower Park has it all - charm, outstanding service, class and reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Historic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AnacoTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower Park is a routine destination of ours during the Christmas season. It is a beautifully restored historic hotel in the heart of downtown Seattle, within walking distance of a host of shopping, dining and entertainment opportunities. With their seasonal specials and broad spectrum of complementary extras it is a very good value. Valet parking is expensive ( $29 /day) but inline with other hotels and Seattle taxes and fees are ridiculous ( not a Mayflower Park problem) The highlights: near perfect location, competently managed, excellent staff at all positions, well maintained and cleaned, have a very good restaurant ( Andaluca) and a great lounge ( Oliver's); internet / local telephone/ daily newspaper are all complementary, lots of TV channels on a modern flat screen, very good bed and linens. Some of the minor shortcomings are just because it is an historic hotel ( built in 1927 and remodeled many times): two painfully slow elevators serve the 12 floors ( at a busy time it can be a long wait); rooms come in a variety of shapes and sizes, some like ours were rather compact ( an observation not a complaint, we were offered others); the lobby men's rest room is 2 flights of stairs down ( and up), the walls are are not exactly soundproof ( our neighbor had a persistent cough). Two short comings that need to be addressed for this quality of hotel: The HVAC in our room was very noisy ( electrical contactor clanked loudly about every 15 minutes during the night when the unit came on /off and the air handler is very loud)- difficult but not impossible to address. Easy to address is the lack of shower gel in the bathroom and the tiny, medium weight bath towels- not even close to what should be offered in this quality of hotel. The positives far outweigh the negatives at the Mayflower Park and that is why we keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: I stayed hear for 11 nights during a recent business trip. The room I had wasn't great , but the bed was confortable and the rest of the hotel was good. The best thing is the bar in the lobby, especially the bar tenders who were friendly and lively! This would be great if you were traveling alone (I wasn't). I would stay here again, although if traveling for pleasure I might have to stay somewhere cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: 48_BLB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here the last 5 times we've been to Seattle. It is an excellent hotel to stay at. It is very central so you can walk to the Downtown department stores, to Pikes Place Market, and many of the Theatres. The Monorail is nextdoor and there are scads of good restaurants close by, including Oliver's and Andaluca which are part of the Mayflower. Rooms are quite comfy, but not overly spacious, unless you book the suites. Service is first class and the rates are excellent. Most packages include parking and a delicious breakfast for two. We used to stay at other hotels in Seattle, but not anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Tops in service”
Reviews.Author: sumnercitizen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a wonderful mix of old fashioned charm and modern amenities. The staff are clearly invested in providing excellent service. It was my wife's birthday and they went the extra mile to make our stay special -- and did so enthusiastically.

Reviews.Title: “One of the reasons we return to Seattle each year.”
Reviews.Author: schark
Reviews.Content: We have made a point of visiting Seattle yearly, for the past three years during the "Black Friday" weekend. Besides the obvious reason - great shopping bargains! - we return to Seattle because it is an attractive city easily reached by car from our home in BC, Canada. For the past few years, after trying other hotels, we have stayed at the Mayflower Park Hotel. We especially enjoy the Mayflower's room rates, central location, friendly & helpful staff, tasteful ambiance, lounge (Oliver's) and restaurant (the Andaluca). When we arrive on Black Fridays, the lobby and Olivers are abuzz with a happy crowd enjoying hot chocolate, home made cookies and drinks awaiting the lighting of the Christmas tree at Westlake Centre, next to the Mayflower, followed by Macy's roof top fire works across the street. Although we have had a room with a view onto the fire works, we always choose to join the outdoor crowds and enjoy the happy atmosphere - a good start to the Christmas season. Upon arrival at the hotel, we park our car and leave it parked for the weekend as everything we want to see/visit is within easy walking distance. Seattle has a wonderful selection of restaurants, interesting neighbourhoods, good shopping and, of course, the always entertaining Pike Place Market. Our stay in the lovely Mayflower, which always includes breakfasts in the Andaluca, adds to our enjoyment of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay esp for first visit to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: wlshade
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean. Service was great. Wish they had movies to order on cable.

Reviews.Title: “My new home in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JustJanetPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the service at the Mayflower Park. I seriously doubt if I will ever stay anywhere else in Seattle. Kelly at the front desk went above and beyond to help us when we stranded ourselves in Fremont. We went to see a play at a little theater not realizing that it was a bit out in the sticks. We tried to call the cab company that took us there but got NO ANSWER. So we called the Mayflower and Kelly sent another cab company for us, tout suite! Then, the morning of our departure, we asked for directions to catch the light rail to the airport. We were a little confused so one of the clerks said he needed a walk anyway and he walked us to the corner! Incredible service in this day and age! The hotel is also beautifully appointed and in an ideal location, close to Macy's, Nordstrom and Pike's Place Market. Thank you Mayflower for restoring my faith in old fashioned service....I will refer everyone I know to you and even some I don't know (aka Trip Advisor).

Reviews.Title: “Mayflower Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great location and cozy atmosphere. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine style and elegance”
Reviews.Author: Ironeaglefitness
Reviews.Content: You will always get mixed reviews on dining and lodging experiences, and the Mayflower is no exception. I had read some less favorable comments before arriving for my stay and I think these folks must have stayed at another hotel because our stay was perfect. The staff is super friendly. The hotel has all the charm and ambiance that you could possibly want. The location is perfect for access to downtown Seattle and Pike's Market. The Light Rail takes you right to the hotel with a hop and a skip through Westlake mall, you never have to go outside to reach the hotel lobby. Stay here - you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm at it's Best”
Reviews.Author: Bayboy56
Reviews.Content: This is my hotel of choice for a couples weekend in Seattle. Excellent rooms and service. (try and get a corner room on a high floor) They have plush robes. This hotel has the romance of an older generation, done right. (elegant not stuffy!) We walk everywhere downtown and to the Pike Place Market. Don't miss it if you're staying in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “No Room, No refund, No Service”
Reviews.Author: Eclectc
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Expedia for $354.88. Mayflower sold my room to someone else. Was moved to a different hotel whose room rate was $99.00. Called Expedia AND Mayflower. They offered to refund me 154.88. That means I would pay $200 for a $100 room. No one takes responsibility. I've traveled for 30 years; never had an experience like that. There's lots of hotels and and online travel agencies. I will not choose or use Expedia or Mayflower Park Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for my first Seattle visit”
Reviews.Author: LMStaton
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel staffed by the friendliest people we met in Seattle. From the time the wonderful valet greeted us to the time we checked out, everything was just about perfect. John at the front desk made checking in simple and fun. The room was absolutely charming. Although the bathroom was a little small, the shower was hot with enough water pressure and delightful toiletries were provided. The bed and pillows were comfy and smelled fresh and clean. The location is wonderful. Everything is within walking distance. Macy's is across the street, Pike Place is 3 blocks away, Starbucks is... well, it's Seattle so Starbucks is EVERYWHERE. There's even a drugstore across the street in case you need to pick up sundries you may have forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Mayflower Park is a elegant, comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OHVirginiaNative
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayflower Park during a convention this past week. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous; refined, yet not stuffy. I initially chose the property as it was one of the more reasonable options for my group. We were not disappointed; even the smaller rooms were comfortable and well appointed. The only complaint that I heard was that even though the beds were comfortable, some would have liked fuller pillows. The fitness room is a converted hotel room, so don't expect much. The best part of my stay was the hotel that adjoins the hotel - Andaluca has the best roasted mussels dish I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Mayflower was Charming, Elegant and Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LuxLyfe
Reviews.Content: Mayflower Park in downtown Seattle is a historic, elegant, charming place with all the comforts of a modern hotel. The service was exceptional; we were greeted by a friendly staff member every time we stepped foot inside. Our deluxe queen suite was large yet cozy with fantastic views of downtown Seattle including the Space Needle. The hotel also happens to be in walking distance to a plethora of fun things to do and see; Pike Place Market, shopping, restaurants; it could not have been more perfect! It was a treat to stay in such a bustling, lively exciting part of this city, especially for my first visit. I really got a feel for the place. P.S. The hotel bar, Oliverâ€™s, is also fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: KHandy1891
Reviews.Content: Mayflower Park is the nicest hotel in the best possible location. My husband and I researched several different hotels when deciding to travel to Seattle for vacation. Mayflower Park seemed to be the best for location and price. We were definitely not disappointed. The hotel is beautiful-outside and inside. Our room had a terrific view (see pic below) of some of the downtown Seattle buildings. The staff was friendly and helpful from the first minute. Our week-long stay was a pleasure. We had delicious food at both Andaluca's and Oliver's (the hotel bar). Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our Regular Getaway in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Queenie145
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live 65 miles from Seattle, so when we have an appointment there, we always spend a couple of nights or so, and make it a little vacation. We tried out several hotels and the Mayflower Park is by far our favorite. The staff is very courteous, friendly and go out of their way to be of service. Love the valet parking and the Andaluca Restaurant downstairs, where the food is absolutely delicious. The rooms at the Mayflower are spacious, clean and quiet. One huge bonus is the location. Very close walking distance to Pike Place Market, Nordstrom, Macy's, Barnes & Noble and a wealth of other shops, banks.and restaurants. Oliver's Lounge is right downstairs in the hotel as well, and you can read the great reviews for it on this site.

Reviews.Title: “October visit to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Charles U
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first time at this wonderful hotel and were thoroughly impressed with the room, staff, and location. I have since recommended this hotel to a number of friends in Anchorage and we will certainly consider it a first-choice when traveling to Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected gem in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Adam C
Reviews.Content: An amazing property in the heart of the action. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful. I was there for 2 nights on business and actually wised I could stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more pleased!”
Reviews.Author: randallsvtc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mayflower four nights, and it was everything we wanted it to be! The service was excellent! My wife and I are in the hospitality business, specializing in renovated historic properties and let me say we both thought the place to be well run, very clean, and tastefully decorated so that the motiff conveyed the feel of a 20's-30's era inn. The Andaluca Restaurant and Oliver's Lounge were on top of their game. Price points, presentation, and selection were on target! Delicious! Hats off to the management team! We could not have been more pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: highlatte
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel. The standard rooms are very small, but pleasantly decorated and squeaky clean. Large lobby with comfortable seating. Go to Olivers for great drinks and the Andaluca Restaurant for a great meal. Best of all, located in a good neighborhood, easy walk to Pike Market, the waterfront, and across the street from the monorail that takes you to the Needle. The light-rail from the airport to Westlake Center is $2.75 pr person, the Mayflower is right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Comfortable, and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: OldWailukuInn
Reviews.Content: In the heart of downtown this small friendly elegant hotel was very comfortable and quiet. Would return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: knittinggrandma
Reviews.Content: The location is right downtown. One could walk there from the new Seattle light rail system provided you walked out the right door of the terminal! The rooms are right on the street and they do tend to be a tad noisy but not as bad as they could be. I had a corner room which are good sized but the bathrooms are downright tiny. The bellmen were ever so much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly K
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower is a great hotel, and I'd definitely stay there again. Very clean, nice staff, very low key. The location could not have been better, close to great restaurants, shopping, two movie theatres and the station for the train to the airport. The bed was comfy. My only minor complaint was the walls in my room were a little thin, so I could hear conversations next door pretty well. Luckily I had quiet and considerate neighbors for every night, except one.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and deep bathtubs”
Reviews.Author: blueiii
Reviews.Content: I love the Mayflower. Even though I don't get any kind of frequent traveler points, I love staying here. The staff is so nice - with manners and a level of service and pride that is hard to find, even in some nicer hotels where I have stayed. The location is great if you want to take the Light Link rail into downtown from the airport (which is a great inexpensive option over taking a cab as long as you don't mind a lot of walking). The hotel is about a block from the Westlake Station. Some of the rooms are a little on the small side, and yes the hotel is old. But I see a welcome attention to cleanliness and I've never smelled a musty smell as some have described. I also love that they have kept the original bathtubs in the bathrooms. They bathrooms are also small and are probably a tight fit for larger people, but I love the deep tubs where you can actually take a nice soak. Also, they have nice bath amenities that are dispensed from larger bottles mounted in the shower and next to the sink. So if you really want to add to your collection of tiny bath supplies, you will be out of luck - but I like the economy of this choice. The comfy robes in each room are a bonus. I would be hard-pressed to find a better choice than the Mayflower!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krys J
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel. Staff was great. Doorman really fun and helpful. Reminiscent of the old classic hotels. The room had two double beds and two baths. Our room looked out at the Space Needle and had a window you could really open to hear the urban sounds of the city. Nice bar/restaurant in hotel but was not serving food after nine pm on weekdays but found out a PF Changs is only two storefronts away and open late. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Riderbill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like older hotels, and this one did not dissapoint. Everything was clean and service was top rate. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: nizora
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night. Could not fault this hotel, even we got smaller room. We picked this hotel again due to its location,location and TV members' recommendations. I would say no more, but would not stop recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service large rooms”
Reviews.Author: calgordon46
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here October 14th and 15th. The room was very well apointed and large, more like a suite. Bed room and sitting room could be divided. Price was very fair. Service was excellent and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and service, needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: Jeeper06
Reviews.Content: The price was fair based on the central location; walking distance from Pike's Market Place and the water, and practically everything else. : ) The room was quite small for the price, however, and it had a musty smell. The service was outstanding, however. After I'd been in my room for about 30 minutes, the front desk called to ask if the room was satisfactory; there are always doormen waiting to get the door for you, and everyone is very friendly. I would stay here again. While the rooms could use a little updating, they are clean and everything I needed was at my fingertips.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat their service & location!”
Reviews.Author: AWC886
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights recently w/the BF & couldn't believe how awesome everything was! As I'm an Entertainment Card member, was able to book the room for 50% off the rack rate, which was still over 20% off the seasonal rate, and there was no fee or penalty for cancellation. The hotel is actually attached to Westlake Center, which is located directly over the Westlake Transit Tunnel, through which not only the LINK rail from Sea-Tac is connected but also several city & suburban express busses pass through. As we'd arrived on the Amtrak, it was a quick (FREE!) ride from the station to the hotel. We arrived a couple of hours prior to check-in but the front desk was very accommodating & gave us a room immediately, with the offer that if we had any issues w/noise or location that they'd willingly move us to a different room. As the hotel's website said, it's decorated in a traditional style so if you're looking for ultra modern, this won't be for you. However, the decor didn't matter to us as much as location, comfort & service and this hotel has all of those in spades! The room is exactly per their website's "Classic Guestroom" photo: generously proportioned w/a separate walk-in closet w/safe, full entertainment armoire, work desk & seating area, the bed linens were wonderful (altho the mattress was a little too soft for my liking), and the bathroom was a decent size too. Their toiletries are very high quality Gieves & Hawkes, which I really appreciated! I also like that their shower curtain rail is curved out so there's no icky wet curtain to stick to your skin. There's plenty of counter space for personal wash bags as well. There's in-room wifi which requires a password (changed monthly) but that's already on a card w/in the room. The signal wasn't always @ full bars but never dropped. I would comment however that there's no fan in the bathroom so the mirrors get foggy, and that the towel rack/bar is located @ the back of the tub/shower enclosure itself & there's only 2 hooks which are installed @ the top of the bathroom door, thus the towels get a bit damp after a shower. Also, when I was trying to hang my towel after showering I either had to hang it over the tub (awkward reach) or jump up to try & catch the door hooks (I'm 5' tall). I would really suggest to the hotel to look @ installing some extra bars/hooks to separate the new/dry towels, which already take up all the space on the existing rack, from used/wet towels elsewhere in the bathroom. The concierge & doormen were really helpful w/dining & shopping suggestions, and due to some pretty wacky weather, we were glad to take advantage of the complimentary umbrellas which were available to guests. We didn't eat in Andaluca but did order an American Breakfast room service to share (yay for US portions!) which was very delicious & delivered promptly on a sturdy wooden tray w/linens & cutlery. We were able to request a late checkout and when I mentioned some noise from the "Occupy Seattle" demonstrations, the lady said we should've told them as they would have happily moved us to a room on the other side of the hotel. The noise wasn't a big deal when the windows were closed tho so I didn't feel like a complaint needed to be made. All in all, the Mayflower Park Hotel is definitely on our list when we visit Seattle again!

Reviews.Title: “Our room could use updating”
Reviews.Author: HappyToTravel_16
Reviews.Content: Hotel might need to update some rooms. The bathroom in ours was a bit dumpy. Wallpaper peeling off the wall. And there was no place to hang a towel around the sink area. Only towel holders were in the shower â€”Â which I hate â€”Â and on the back of the door. We stayed here at the end of a trip to Seattle. At the beginning of the trip we stayed at the Hyatt Olive 8 and it was really nice. New hotels are the way to go. Or updated ones...

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY”
Reviews.Author: vwlizard1
Reviews.Content: We had 3 in our party for a girls getaway. We arrived on Wednesday for a real treat. This hotel is truly amazing. The staff is extremely courteous and friendly. The rooms are spotless and the bellman Sen was so friendly and helpful. The room itself had 2 beds and 2 restrooms so we were able to get ready alot faster than with just one. This was a pleasant surprise. It is an easy walk to lots of shops and Pike Place market which is alot of fun. I cannot say enough about the service we received while we were there. They even had a free wine tasting on Wednesday evening and that was alot of fun. I would highly recommend the Mayflower Park to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor communication”
Reviews.Author: TrnrMom
Reviews.Content: This is an edited review - I deleted my earlier review due to what happened after we checked out. Service - top notch, room - very comfortable, clean. Size of room - on the small side, but well appointed - coffee, TV, ice only on certain floors. Size of bathroom - ok, shower only, but only 18" between edge of sink & wall of shower - large people are in trouble. Back to service - have to mention how helpful the doormen were. They held bags for us before we checked in (after some discussion), and again on our return. Concierge & doormen were great with directions & looked up bus routes as well. Why the edit? We were here on a group rate and entered a special code into the website. The quote I was given had tax = 0.00. Since the regular website quote showed tax, I assumed tax was included in the special rate. When I questioned it on check out, it was taken off (I had the e-mail confirmation), but then charged to my card two days later. Though they were correct that the tax was due (I was going to challenge it on my credit card but checked the group's site & it did say "+ tax"), I feel a call or e-mail was appropriate explaining the re-charge. Thus, 1 star taken off a 5* review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: We especially enjoyed the Andaluca restaurant, excellent food and friendly staff. Location in the center of town made our sightseeig very convienient. Higlhly recommend for a Seattle stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Seattle Stay”
Reviews.Author: joemo7
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location,classic designed rooms and a friendly staff. We were checked in early on our arrival to a warm and cozy queen room. The bed linens, towels and wonderful bathrobes were a welcome treat coming in from the Olympic National Parks! Small details like a soap dish, large hand cream and shampoos and the best amenity-a multiple electric port that handled all of our electronics were really appreciated! What a concept! Thank you! Great idea! We had a breakfast/parking package that was perfect for us. The car valet was quick, friendly and helpful with directions. Breakfast choices were excellent with large but tasty portions. Dinner at Andaluca was excellent as was Oliver's snacks. What a great location for sightseeing-walking or catching the city transit! This is the hotel of "yes", I can help you. The professional, friendly staff made our stay perfect in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth H
Reviews.Content: We read reviews, looked at maps, and asked friends who had traveled to Seattle. The Mayflower Park Hotel was an easy and wise choice for us. Returning from a l0-day cruise, we needed a comfortable, well-located place to spend a few days. We were not disappointed. Our room was an upgrade, everyone associated with the hotel was extremely helpful, and the location allowed us to do all of the things we had planned for our Seattle Get-a-Way.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel...and I'm hard to please.”
Reviews.Author: Pjmb1976
Reviews.Content: After a very bad start in a horrible hotel in Seattle we moved to Mayflower Park hotel and all I can say is that it did not disapoint......lovely hotel, lovely beds, great staff and beautiful building. The room was gorgeous. The food was lovely in the restaurant. the only faults I found was the fact my daughter couldn't go into the bar at all.....she's under 21. I can understand minors not sitting at the bar but they are usually allowed in some part of the bar. Made is awkward to order food during the day. Also the breakfast was a little overpriced. Overall though this hotel will not disapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room”
Reviews.Author: JAN B
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for walking around Seattle. The room was "ok" clean but nothing special. We had 2 queens and because of how they were situated my husband and I sleep in separate beds so we wouldn't have to crawl over one another to get out of bed! For the price I would most likely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent unique stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Elham K
Reviews.Content: It was really a beautiful, clean, safe and luxury stay in the May flower park hotel. The room is very cozy with beautiful decoration The hotel team also are very friendly. I wanted to change my room for some reasons and they were very helpful. I enjoyed my stay there really..

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey H
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience at the Mayflower! I couldn't ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with a good location”
Reviews.Author: fussylady001
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location in downtown Seattle - within walking distance to major attractions and retail. We had one of the four suites available - a corner room - which is well worth the cost. There was good natural light and cross ventilation. The hotel has been nicely renovated with comfortable seating areas and good lighting, sometimes a rarity in hotels. The bathroom could use a little better lighting and more surface to put toiletries. Robes are provided. The hotel is clean and staff is very accommodating. There is complimentary wi-fi and, if you need them, computers available to guests. Breakfast is not included, but there are plenty of places nearby to get a light meal. (There seems to be a Starbucks on every corner. Not surprising since they started here.) For dinner, one night, we wanted a casual dinner and the concierge directed us to the Icon Grill, a restaurant with a wide variety of choices. Despite its casualness, the place is decorated with a lot of art, including an abundance of Chihuly glass. It was a good recommendation. You will need a car to get to places like Bellvue or Capitol Hill, home of the renowned Elliott Bay Book Store. However, the hotel provides valet parking and they are very efficient at retrieving your car quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Edistotiger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights for a business conference. The hotel is an older property but very nicely furnished. The room, while small (common for older properties), was very comfortable & adequate for one person. The only complaint was that the lamps were a little dim for reading. The bathroom was on the small side (again, common for older properties) but fine for me. Instead of small bottles of shampoo, etc, there were larger pump bottles of shampoo, conditioner, & lotion in the bathroom (a good brand) which makes more sense to me. There were plenty of towels as well as robes in the room. The bed was very comfortable. I had requested a refrigerator when I made my reservation, and one was already in my room when I checked in. The staff was very courteous and helpful throughout my stay, even getting me a taxi within 10 minutes at 5am. Internet access is free. There are 2 small computers available for free use in the lobby (15 minute limit per session) & you can print your boarding passes. The concierge was always helpful. There is a restaurant & lounge on the premises. I did not try the restaurant but Seattle locals I talked to in my meetings said that it is very good. The lounge is good; the appetizers are big enough for a meal. The hotel is very centrally located. It is within 1 block of the Light Rail to the airport and the monorail to the Space Needle. It is only 3 blocks from the Pike Street market & within easy walking distance of lots of shopping & restaurants. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here & would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel -great location”
Reviews.Author: cmsasis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in September and really enjoyed the hotel. The front desk people were friendly and ready to answer questions. The doors were always opened for us and staff were ready to help with luggage. The hotel has some beautiful features and it is charming. The rooms are small but quite comfortable. The location to everything was great - easy to walk to the market and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Frances N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days the last week of August. It was close to just about anyplace you would want to visit in downtown Seattle. I especially liked that you are able to get to the Westlake Center and also to the Monorail without even having to go outside. The staff were very nice and I only ate at the restaurant for one lunch and one dinner. The food was good. All in all, a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Foyelady
Reviews.Content: This hotel has charm galore and the location is great. Its across the street from a large Macy's Dept Store and a 5-10 minute walk to the Pike Place Public Market and a quirky restaurant called The Pink Door. Conveniently there is a large drug chain store across the street in the opposite direction. There's a lot of shopping in the area. The hotel staff is very helpful and pleasant. The hotel upgraded me to a junior suite which had a full bath & a 3/4 bath, 2 large closets, a living area and a separate bedroom with 2 queen beds. There were french doors between the living and bedroom areas and a flat screen TV in each area. The view looked out on the Space Needle & the lights of the city. The lobby is relaxed in an almost European style. This hotel is sort of old school, in a good way. The Mayflower Park was perfect for a woman travelling alone because it has human scale and a genteel quality. By the way, breakfast in Andaluca, their casual restaurant, was delicious and they put plenty on the plate!!

Reviews.Title: “Mayflower Park hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leebird622
Reviews.Content: This hotel was centrally located near boutiques, restaurants and Pike's Place. Rooms are small but workable. Only one night stand next to queen size bed, however. Staff was helpful and the hotel had a lovely sitting room up a small flight of stairs, opposite a very nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: PDXGAL59
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel and the lobby, restaurant/bar and staff are great, but the rooms are very small and noisy! Our room was right next to the maid's closet and the clanging and slamming of doors was so loud! The room lacked a desk so, if you need to work, you'd be out of luck. That said, the price is reasonable for Seattle and the location is perfect so I'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy warm hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravellady
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Maayflower Park hotel. Service was very attentive and friendly. Location was great, close to everything that we wanted to see. The room was on the small side but comfortable. My only suggestion to make the room work better, each bedside should have a nightstand. Restaurant and bar on the premises were both very good. A close walk to Pikes Place market. Loved kolas for breakfast, a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay before cruises.”
Reviews.Author: davidski1
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights before our Alaskan cruise to be downtown and to explore Seattle. Hotel was great, a little on the pricey side, very close to seattle attractions. Staff was very helpful, friendly and went out of their way to direct us to the sights. very close to subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “For my next vacation, I just want to go stay at the Mayflower Park for a week!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca W
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower Park Hotel is beautiful, charming, and an absolutely wonderful place to stay. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful, the rooms lovely and comfortable, and the hotel, overall, is elegant yet inviting. In planning our pre- and post-cruise stay in Seattle, my friend and I wanted to find a nice downtown location, and a unique hotel that would add to a great vacation experience. The Mayflower Park far exceeded those expectations, and our stay there was memorable in and of itself. The cruise package, which included transportation to and from the pier, as well as breakfast in the excellent Andaluca restaurant, was great. No worries, no stress - the staff took care of everything, and we had a great start to our travel days. I would also like to extend a special "thank you" to the manager at the registration desk for his kindness. When we returned from our cruise on Sunday morning, we were exhausted. Although it was still before check-out time (and long before check-in time), I asked him when our room might be ready, and he offered to call us as soon as it was available. Not 15 minutes later, we received the call AND we had been given an upgrade to a suite. It hardly needs to be said that we were treated very, very well at the Mayflower Park, and highly recommend this marvelous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stepping back into the Gilded Age”
Reviews.Author: ChristinafromNY
Reviews.Content: In a perfect location in the heart of downtown Seattle, the Mayflower Park Hotel epitomizes elegance and old world style: every aspect of our stay was perfectly lovely. It offers all the charm of the earlier era in which it was built, while maintaining all the modern conveniences as well. My husband and I were able to walk to all the sights we wanted to see, and were also advised by our friendly and knowledgable front desk clerk while we checked-in; we enjoyed the hotel so much, we decided to stay a second night to bask in the luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: ukienomad
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one evening here after our cruise and it was lovely. The check in person was very friendly and helpful, the (deluxe) room was large and the linens were great - pillows, bedding, towels, etc. The room was very clean and decorated in a traditional style. The lobby area was lovely with chandeliers and fresh flowers. All the employees there were wonderful. They had a happy hour that had shrimp coconut, breaded shrimp, vegetables & dip....it was great. They kept our luggage the next day until we departed. They also have free internet service. The hotel was much classier than the one we stayed at before our cruise (the Warwick).....a little bit more money but it was worth it. We would definitely recommend this place and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Service, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Teresa V
Reviews.Content: We were trying to decide which hotel to stay at. We found several in our price range, but couldn't decide so we went for a Travelocity Mystery hotel. The one we chose was well reviewed even though they don't tell you the name until after you book. We took a chance and ended up at the Mayflower Park Hotel. It was right in the middle of downtown, right where we wanted to be. We flew in and took the Light Rail from Sea Tac Airport and got off within a few blocks of the hotel. The Mayflower Park Hotel is older but beautifully redone in pretty original form. It was extremely clean and the staff made us feel like we were old friends visiting. We were invited to a wine tasting in the restaurant and were served in a first class manner. Our room was nicely decorated and had everything we needed.
